p: The sample included 313 male participants who were married or cohabitating at baseline (Mean age: 40.8 years, Standard deviation [SD] = 5.6; Table 1). The median percent days alcohol abstinent increased over time (Baseline: 36.7, Interquartile range [IQR] = 66.7; 12-month follow-up: 76.7, IQR = 66.7). The proportion of participants who screened positive for depressive symptoms decreased over time (Baseline: N = 68/313, 21.7%; 12-month follow-up: N = 43/279, 15.4%).
